entry.title: CGIpaf uploaded to github
entry.content:
I finally converted the cgipaf cvs repository to github.

I used cvs2git It took a bit longer than expected.

My first attempt didn't had the release tags right.

Adding --retain-conflicting-attic-files to cvs2git resolved this issue.

You'll find how I did it it below.

cvs2git.sh:

``` cvs2git \

--blobfile=cvs2git-tmp/git-blob.dat \
--dumpfile=cvs2git-tmp/git-dump.dat \
/var/lib/cvs/cgipaf \
--username=staf \
--retain-conflicting-attic-files

```

create local git:

$ mkdir ~/newgit $ cd ~/newgit $ mkdir cgipaf $ cd cgipaf $ git init Initialized empty Git repository in /home/staf/newgit/cgipaf/ $

import.sh:

```

!/bin/bash

git fast-import --export-marks=/home/staf/cvs2git-tmp/cvs2git-marks.dat < /home/staf/cvs2git-tmp/git-blob.dat git fast-import --import-marks=/home/staf/cvs2git-tmp/cvs2git-marks.dat < /home/staf/cvs2git-tmp/git-dump.dat ```

push to github:

``` git remote add origin git@github.com:stafwag/cgipaf.git git push origin --mirror

```
